column4:
// init NAME_BLANK, $1b
賽亞?
我剛剛才和他聊
過天而已。
不過他一看到月
亮之後，
就緊張兮兮往天
文台跑去了。
column5:
// init NAME_BLANK, $1b
Hmm, your dad? I just had a chat with him.

But as soon as he saw the moon today, he immediately ran towards the observatory.

I wonder what's up with him?
column6: machine translation assisted, original mentions the dad by name

column4:
// init NAME_BLANK, $13
⋯啊?
要找你爸爸回家
吃晚餐啊。
真是孝順的小孩
。
媽媽病逝後，
要更堅強喲!
啊啊啊!!
又提到這件事~
真是對不起。
column5:
// init NAME_BLANK, $13
...Huh?
Is that for your dad?
How nice of you! Your mom would be proud!
Ah, so sorry for mentioning her!
column6:
孝順 carries connotations of filial piety but i'm not sure if that translates well in a western context

媽媽病逝後，
要更堅強喲! means more along the lines of "you must stay strong after (your) mum's death (by disease)!" oddly positive for the subject matter tbh

column4:
// init NAME_BLANK, $20
是你啊!
哈哈哈~
昨天考試，你又
考輸我了!
嘻嘻~
每‧次‧都‧輸
‧我!
column5:
// init NAME_BLANK, $20
Haha! Looks like you lost to me in the exam!

I win again!
I always do!
column6:
每‧次‧都‧輸
‧我! carries a sort of mocking tone in that the words are spaced apart

column4:
// init NAME_BLANK, $1d

。

machine translation assisted

column4:
// init NAME_BLANK, $16
唉呀~
最近的月亮怎麼
看起來，
有點藍藍的呢?

花了。
column6: "我眼睛又花" means "i must be short-sighted again" but seems long winded

column4:
// init NAME_BLANK, $19
新聞報導說，
明天晚上會有大
規模的流星雨。
記得我年輕的時
候，
也曾預測過一次
。
但那次的預測錯
誤。
告訴你峨!
婆婆年輕的時候
~
是村子裡有名的
⋯⋯
大‧美‧女‧峨
!
column5:
// init NAME_BLANK, $19
The news has reported that there will be a massive meteor shower tomorrow night.

I remember once when I was young, they forecast the same thing. But that time, the prediction was wrong.

I'm telling you! When my grandmother was young, she was a famous beauty in the village!
column6: again, spaced out words for emphasis, also idk how grandmother got machine translated as mother in law

column4:
// init NAME_BLANK, $22
啊!?
隼人說突然想打

個網球場!

// init NAME_BLANK, $22
What? Hayato said he suddenly wanted to play tennis?
No problem!
I'm going to buy a tennis court!
column6: said by the dad, presumably, but it doesn't make as much sense in english

// init NAME_12, $26
OH~
BABY~
我今天到朋友家
，
看到了很多的發
明品喲!
他可是個天才的
機械科學家。

的科學家喲!

// init NAME_12, $26
Oh, baby~

I went to my friend's house today. I saw many inventions there!

He's such a genius roboticist, looks like your dad can learn a thing or two from him~

毯，

孩。

// init NAME_BLANK, $1f
Ahhh!!!
How could you bring a dog into someone's house?!
I just cleaned my carpet, and now it's dirty again! You uneducated child!
column6: 換了新地毯 means "changed to a new carpet" but is usually also said to denote having switched it out (for a carpet in the wash)
